intro: Gouania guiengolensis, commonly known as the Guianan gouania, is a flowering plant species native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Gouania guiengolensis is often found in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the humid conditions of its native habitat.
